metadata.title: CVE-2014-9764 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
imlib2 before 1.4.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(segmentation fault) via a crafted GIF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9764` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libimlib2 - 1.4.6-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imlib2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.6-2ubuntu0.1').
